short_description: A classic novel set in the American South during the 1930s, dealing with the issues of racial injustice and moral growth.
A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime, exploring themes of surveillance, government oppression, and individual freedom.
A novel set in the Jazz Age, depicting the American Dream, excess, and moral decay through the lives of wealthy socialites.
A romantic novel set in early 19th-century England, focusing on themes of love, marriage, and societal expectations.
A coming-of-age novel narrated by a teenager, Holden Caulfield, who reflects on the phoniness of adult society.
A novel that follows the voyage of the Pequod, led by the obsessed Captain Ahab, as they hunt the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.
A bildungsroman novel that follows the experiences of Jane Eyre, an orphan, as she grows into adulthood and finds love.
A fantasy novel that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he sets out to reclaim the Lonely Mountain and its treasure from the dragon Smaug.

book_name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
short_description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the adventures of a young wizard, Harry Potter, as he attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

book_name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
short_description: The first part of the epic fantasy trilogy that follows the journey of Frodo Baggins to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.
A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic nation, where teenagers are forced to participate in a televised death match called the Hunger Games.
A science fiction novel that follows the struggle for survival of an astronaut stranded on Mars after his crew presumed him dead and left the planet.
